oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PREDICTIVE TOOL OF SEAGRASS HEALTH TO OPTIMIZE THE DESIGN OF LOW CRESTED STRUCTURES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Escudero, Mireille
Marbà, Núria
Garrido, Joaquín
Molines, Jorge
Ripoll, Enrique
Medina, Josep Ramon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the last decade, the growing interest in the development of Nature-based Solutions (NbS) for climate change adaptation and disaster risk reduction has led to the development of new Low-Crested Structures (LCS) and types of armor units to favour the settlement and colonization of marine species on the structures, and thus, mimic the behavior of natural reefs. However, little attention has been paid to the ecological consequences of the construction of breakwaters by altering circulation and sediment transport to adjacent habitats, such as seagrasses.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; management.50
